info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 21 at 1:01PM PDT until March 24 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches with locally 18 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades and Southern Oregon Cascades from Howard Prairie northward. This includes Highway 140 at Lake of the Woods, Highway 62 near Union Creek and Crater Lake, Highway 230, Highway 58 at Willamette Pass and Highway 138 at Diamond Lake. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult with snow covered roads and significantly reduced visibility at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates may approach 1 inch per hour at times Thursday afternoon/evening and again late Thursday night into Friday. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.
